Hong Kong: West Kowloon Hotel Doubles Dishes on Themed Buffet Nights 
Foodie Friday 
The Kitchen at the W Hong Kong serves themed buffets Monday to Thursday, when it doubles the number of dishes to 30! Can't make up your mind which theme you prefer? Wait for the weekend! Seafood station at The Kitchen in W Hong Kong on Asian Feast night. Photo Credit: Accidental Travel Writer. 

The Kitchen is a stylish bistro, one of 4 food and beverage outlets at W Hong Kong, which is located in West Kowloon, adjoining the Elements shopping mall. It serves sumptuous international buffets at breakfast, lunch and dinner. 
The Kitchen has doubled the number of dishes it serves at its buffets to 30, offering a different theme Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. 
I had dinner there with friends on the night that Asian food was featured. It was quite a spread. While it was predominately Asian, it was not exclusively Asian. 
There were several other international favourties, as well, including lots of fresh seafood, an extensive salad bar, and an mouth-watering array of desserts. 
The restaurant features an open kitchen with live cooking stations as well as an excellent wine list, contemporary - yet whimsicle - surroundings, and stunning views of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong skyline. 
Themed Buffets Japanese sushi and sashimi station at The Kitchen in W Hong Kong on Asian Feast night. Photo Credit: Accidental Travel Writer. Monday: Seafood Galore 
Rumour has it that this is the most popular of the eatery's 4 themed buffets, serving 3 types of oysters freshly imported from France and Australia, a fresh catch of succulent steamed fish, mussels, clams, crab, and lobster. Tuesday: Asian Feast 
There is a pan-Asian menu on Tuesdays, with everything from Indian tandoori and Chinese dim to Japanese sushi, Thai curries, and Indonesian satays. Wednesday: Butcher’s Barbeque 
Meat lovers will feel right at home on Wednesdays, when they will find a roasted whole suckling pig, marinated sirloin Angus beef, Grilled Thüringen sausage, Roasted whole salmon filet tamarind, BBQ large squid, and more. Thursday: Japanese Night 
Fresh sushi and sashimi plus and a Japanese Robata live grill station serving grilled sanma with teriyaki sauce, and Grilled skirt steak wagyu beef with yuzu cilantro butter are the order of the day on Thursdays. 
Yummy Desserts Michael Taylor checks out the innovative presentations at the dessert table. Photo Credit: Accidental Travel Writer. 
I you can't make up your mind which theme you like best - or if there's a difference of opinion in your party - wait until the weekend, when the best of the other 4 nights is on offer. 
And make sure to leave room for dessert! There is an extensive array of desserts each night, many of which feature very innovative presentations. 
Where 
The Kitchen, W Hong Kong, 1 Austin Road West, Kowloon Station, West Kowloon, Kowloon, Hong Kong. Telephone: (852) 3717-2222. Website: W Hong Kong 
The hotel adjoins the Elements shopping mall, which has direct access to Kowloon Station. It is a short taxi ride from the Star Ferry, Ocean Terminal, Canton Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hung Hom Station, the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, Mongkok, and other points on the Kowloon Peninsula.
